title: Why did hospitals have these frogs in their supply rooms? - Carly Anne York

multiple-choice.question: What was the primary role of African clawed frogs in pregnancy testing from the 1930s to the 1960s?

options.text: To detect the presence of chorionic gonadotropin hormone (hCG) in urine samples

options.label: B
options.text: To test the effects of various chemicals on frog development

options.label: C
options.text: To serve as a model organism for studying the pituitary gland

options.label: D
options.text: To assist in the fertilization of frog eggs

options.label: C
options.text: Their smooth skin that can quickly change color to blend into surroundings

options.label: D
options.text: Their ability to suck food directly into their mouths

options.label: C

options.label: C
options.text: They were more accurate in detecting hCG

options.label: D
options.text: They were less expensive to use

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: They have been superseded by chemical tests that detect hCG directly

options.label: D
options.text: They are no longer considered invasive species

options.label: A
options.text: They can be used to test the effects of various chemicals on frog development

options.label: B
options.text: They can be used to study the pituitary gland

options.label: C
options.text: They can carry a deadly fungus that can cause an infection that lethally disrupts the functioning of amphibian skin

options.label: D

options.label: A
